name: digitalle
tag_list: digital-asset-management, digital-content-management, digital-cms, business-social-networks, white-label-social-networks, saas, iaas, paas, social-commerce, digital-commerce
overview:
Digitalle.com is a specialist supplier of digital content, asset and information management services via cloud based solutions accessed through “very clever” but simple websites.

The company focuses on delivering solutions that enable businesses and organisations to leverage, and where appropriate, to monetise their digital content and assets in exciting, useful, and highly profitable ways.

Digitalle offers its enterprise CMS platform as a hosted licence, and also provides Software as a Service (SaaS) products, Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS), and finally mobile device applications (Apps) development.

Under the digitalle umbrella, the company’s 2 areas of expertise are in publishing via their Paperlesse.com brand, and white label social networking under the Socialle.com brand.

Paperlesse enables publishers of any content which can be stored digitally, from film clips to news stories, market research to UGC, to manage and publish their content from a single enterprise CMS. Essentially, content owners and creators can publish to any medium, from web to mobile, or App to physical print.

Socialle provides an enterprise social networking platform, which can exist independently as, for example, a “mini-Facebook” which can be completely re-branded to a company’s corporate brand, or as a the heart of corporate social network or digital asset management (DAM) system.

Both are sold as part of the digitalle CMS platform and are available as individual “chunks” of functionality in Essential, Professional and Enterprise levels. They can also be woven seemlessly together with other licences in the stable to create a bespoke solution tailored to a customers’ needs.

Digitalle therefore offers any company or organisation who needs to publish information, (whether to web, mobile, App or print), and manage the access to that information, a “one stop shop” to manage the entire process from inception right through to publication and subscription.
